intro: Jasione montana f. echinata, commonly known as the spiked rock-jasmine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and upright flowering stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by spherical, hairy seed pods. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
